comment:
The champagne yeast is for bottling after:
Primary fermentation at 45-55F for 7-21 days; when krausen falls, gradually raise temperature for diacetyl rest at 64F for 2-7 days; gradually return temperature to 55F for 2-3 days. At this time, transfer to a secondary carboy, gradually lower temperature to 30F, hold for two days, then allow to lager for three weeks at lagering temperatures: 33-55F; bottle with champagne yeast and corn sugar to produce 2.5 vols. CO2.
